skills.name: acrobatics
skills.description: Performing feats of gymnastics, extraordinary balance, and dance (and related performance arts), as well as breaking falls. useful for running obstacle courses or doing courtly promenade.

skills.name: fighting
skills.description: Competence in unarmed combat.

skills.name: climbing
skills.description: Scaling various surfaces.

skills.name: contortion
skills.description: Escaping from otherwise secure physical bonds by twisting, writhing, and contorting the body.

skills.name: dodge
skills.description: Slipping out of danger's way, whether avoiding an attack or a sprung booby trap.

skills.name: flying
skills.description: Maneuvering under one's own power (such as with wings).

skills.name: jumping
skills.description: Leaping over obstacles.

skills.name: melee combat
skills.description: Wielding hand-to-hand weapons.

skills.name: riding
skills.description: Controlling and riding domesticated mounts.

skills.name: stealth
skills.description: Moving silently and avoiding detection, whether through shadows or crowds.

skills.name: charioteering
skills.description: Accelerating, steering, and decelerating chariots (in particular) or any kind of cart-and-animal vehicle.

skills.name: lockpicking
skills.description: Opening a mechanical lock without possessing the key or combination.

skills.name: marksmanship
skills.description: Shooting any kind of mechanical device — such as a bow or sling — that projects missiles across a distance.

skills.name: pilotry
skills.description: Operating any water-faring vehicle, including steering, applying the oars, or managing the sails.

skills.name: sleight of hand
skills.description: Nimbleness with the fingers and misdirection, including picking pockets, palming items, and stage magic.

skills.name: throwing
skills.description: Hitting a target accurately with a thrown item, including stones, javelins, bottles, and knives. Also used for catching thrown items.

skills.name: lifting
skills.description: Moving or lifting heavy objects, as well as representing the ability to inflict additional damage with strength-powered weapons.

skills.name: running
skills.description: Moving quickly on the ground while avoiding obstacles and keeping from stumbling.

skills.name: stamina
skills.description: Physical endurance and resistance to pain, disease, and poison.

skills.name: swimming
skills.description: Moving and surviving in a liquid medium.

skills.name: cultures
skills.description: Comprehension of customs, traditions, art, history, politics, and views on outsiders of various regions or groups, as well as the ability to generalize about common cultural forms.

skills.name: devices
skills.description: Using and designing complex mechanical equipment. Actually building items requires crafting.

skills.name: healing
skills.description: Dressing wounds, applying splints, and disinfecting injuries, plus an understanding and application of medical procedures, such as diagnosing illnesses and performing surgery.

skills.name: navigation
skills.description: Determining the correct course using external reference points, such as stars, maps, or landmarks, as well as creating maps.

skills.name: reading/writing
skills.description: Familiarity with and ability to understand various forms of written communication, as well as the ability to create literary compositions, including forging papers and identifying such forgeries. Characters do not begin with the ability to read or write.

skills.name: scholar
skills.description: This skill represents knowledge and/or education in areas not covered under any other skill (such as alchemy, cooking, arcane lore, etc.). This may be restricted to a specific field (represented by specializations) or a general knowledge of a wide range of subjects. It is used to remember details, rumors, tales, legends, theories, important people, and the like, as appropriate for the subject in question. However, the broader the category, the fewer the details that can be recalled. It covers what the character himself can recall. Having another skill as a specialization of the scholar skill means that the character knows the theories and history behind the skill but can't actually use it. Scholar can be useful with investigation to narrow a search for information.

skills.name: speaking
skills.description: Familiarity with and ability to understand various forms of verbal communication. Characters know the Trade Speech (assuming the setting has one) and one 'native' language in which they have spoken fluency. Additional languages in which a character has proficiency can be represented by specializations of this skill.

skills.name: trading
skills.description: Knowledge of business practices, exchange rates, the monetary value of goods and opportunities, and other information regarding barter and sales, including the ability to determine how to make money with another skill the character has. Trading can complement bluff, charm, and persuasion when haggling over prices for goods and services being bought or sold.

skills.name: traps
skills.description: Installing, altering, and bypassing security devices, as well as identifying various kinds of traps (gas, pit, wire-triggered, etc.).

skills.name: artist
skills.description: Making works of art, like paintings, music compositions, and dance choreographies.

skills.name: crafting
skills.description: Creating, fixing, or modifying equipment, weapons, armor, and vehicles, as well as woodworking, metalworking, constructing buildings, and the like.

skills.name: disguise
skills.description: Altering features or clothing to be unrecognizable or to look like someone else. Also useful in acting performances.

skills.name: gambling
skills.description: Playing and cheating at games of strategy and luck.

skills.name: investigation
skills.description: Gathering information, researching topics, analyzing data, and piecing together clues.

skills.name: know-how
skills.description: Figuring out how to perform an action in which the character does not have experience, as well as a catch-all skill encompassing areas not covered by other skills (such as utilitarian sewing or cooking).

skills.name: search
skills.description: Spotting hidden objects or people, reconnoitering, lipreading, or eavesdropping on or watching another person.

skills.name: streetwise
skills.description: Finding information, goods, and contacts in an urban environment, particularly through thieves' guilds and similar criminal organizations, black markets, and other illicit operations. Also useful for determining possible motives and methods of criminals.

skills.name: survival
skills.description: Surviving in wilderness environments, including the ability to identify plants, animals, and their nutritional and medicinal uses.

skills.name: tracking
skills.description: Following the trail of another person, animal, or creature, or keeping after a moving target without being noticed.

skills.name: animal handling
skills.description: Controlling animals and making them perform tricks and follow commands.

skills.name: bluff
skills.description: Lying, tricking, or deceiving others, as well as verbal evasion, misdirection, and blustering. Disguise can complement uses of this skill. Also useful in putting on acting performances.

skills.name: charm
skills.description: Using friendliness, flattery, or seduction to influence someone else. Also useful in sales and bartering transactions, putting on performances (such as singing, acting, or storytelling), and situations involving etiquette.

skills.name: command
skills.description: Effectively ordering and coordinating others in team situations.

skills.name: intimidation
skills.description: Using physical presence, verbal threats, taunts, torture, or fear to influence others or get information out of them.

skills.name: mettle
skills.description: Ability to withstand stress, temptation, other people's interaction attempts, mental attacks, and pain. The gamemaster may allow a specialization in a specific faith tradition or belief system to enhance many, though not all, applications of mettle.

skills.name: persuasion
skills.description: Influencing others or getting information out of them through bribery, honest discussion, debate, diplomacy, or speeches. Also useful in negotiations, business transactions, storytelling, and oration.

skills.name: alteration - magic
skills.description: Casting spells involving change.

skills.name: apportation - magic
skills.description: Casting spells involving movement.

skills.name: divination - magic
skills.description: Casting spells involving knowledge.

skills.name: conjuration - magic
skills.description: Casting spells involving creation.

skills.name: divination - miracle
skills.description: Requesting divine aid to gain knowledge of the past, present, or future.

skills.name: favor - miracle
skills.description: Requesting divine aid to help, improve, heal, or benefit someone or something.

skills.name: strife - miracle
skills.description: Requesting divine aid to cause injury or destruction.
